archetype_name: Family Extra-Hot Chili Night (Caribbean & Mexican, 15–30, Simple)
name: Extra-Hot Ghost Pepper Jerk Beef Skewers over Chipotle-Pineapple Coconut Rice
description: Blazing jerk-style beef skewers fired with ghost chilli and allspice, served on coconut rice tossed with chipotle-glazed pineapple and black beans.
prep_steps: If using wooden skewers, soak 8 skewers in water for 10 minutes.
cook_steps: In a bowl, mix olive oil, lime juice, allspice, salt, black pepper, minced garlic, and minced ghost chilli.
Add the cubed sirloin steak to the marinade and toss to coat. Thread beef and pineapple alternately onto skewers.
Preheat an outdoor grill (or a hot grill pan on the stovetop) to medium-high. Oil the grates or pan lightly.
Grill skewers 6–8 minutes total, turning every 2 minutes until beef is charred outside and just cooked to your liking. Brush chipotle chilli sauce over skewers during the last minute on each side.
While skewers grill, warm a large pan on the stovetop over medium. Add coconut rice and a splash of water; stir until hot and fluffy, 2–3 minutes.
Fold black beans and half the spring onion into the hot coconut rice. Season with a pinch of salt and black pepper to taste.
Plate coconut rice, top with skewers, drizzle any extra chipotle chilli sauce, and finish with remaining spring onion.

ingredients.preparation: finely minced; reduce for less heat

final_ingredients.preparation: finely minced; reduce for less heat
